definition: to soar/to glide/variant of 詳|详[xiang2]

pinyin: xuan2 gua4 shi4 hua2 xiang2 ji1

sentences.english: He flies a motor  glider and small airplanes.
sentences.chinese: 现在他可以驾驶电动滑翔机和小型飞机。

sentences.english: Currents of warm air keep the hang-gliders aloft.
sentences.chinese: 悬挂式滑翔机借着暖气流在高空飞行。

sentences.english: Power -driven heavier - than -air aircraft shall give way to gliders.
sentences.chinese: 重于空气的动力驱动飞机应该给滑翔机让路。

sentences.english: The glider uncoupled from the two planes.
British paratroopers writing slogans on their Horsa gliding plane.
sentences.chinese: 写在他们的滑翔机霍萨英国伞兵的口号。

sentences.english: The man who first experimented with sailplanes hoped to imitate the flight of birds.
sentences.chinese: 首先使用滑翔机作实验的人是想模仿鸟的飞行。

sentences.english: It was as if the glider wasn't there.
sentences.chinese: 这种感觉，就好像滑翔机根本就不在我身上一样。

sentences.english: Some of the airborne forces were carried toward their destinations by gliders towed behind transport aircraft.
sentences.chinese: 某些空降部队乘坐由运输机拖拽的滑翔机前往目的地。

sentences.english: By the cliff where the hang-glider took off.
sentences.chinese: 在悬崖边看滑翔机起飞。

sentences.english: Gliders equipped with radio and recording instruments have been flown into the core of thunderstorms.
sentences.chinese: 装有无线电设备和记录仪的滑翔机曾飞进雷暴的中心。

sentences.english: The glider uncoupled from the tow plane.
The glider was winched off the ground.
sentences.chinese: 那架滑翔机由绞车拖离地面。

sentences.english: One fell hard enough to break the glider's sturdy aluminum strut.
sentences.chinese: 人们都恨不得折断滑翔机上那段坚硬的铝支杆。

sentences.english: The film was taken by a camera mounted on a hang - glider .
sentences.chinese: 这部影片是用摄影机系在悬挂式滑翔机上拍摄的。

sentences.english: The stresses caused by flying too fast could peel the wings from the sailplane.
sentences.chinese: 飞行过快而引起的应力会使滑翔机的机翼脱落。

pinyin: xuan2 gua4 shi4 hua2 xiang2 ji1

definition: see 直升機|直升机[zhi2 sheng1 ji1]
